title: Cresset
text:
A cresset is a metal cup or basket, often mounted to or suspended from a <a href="Column">pole</a>, containing <a href="Petroleum">oil</a>, <a href="Pitch%20%28resin%29">pitch</a>, a rope steeped in <a href="rosin">rosin</a> or something <a href="flammable">flammable</a>. They are burned as a <a href="light">light</a> or <a href="beacon">beacon</a>.
Cressets mounted on the walls of <a href="Renaissance">Renaissance</a> palaces in <a href="Italy">Italy</a> were the first form of <a href="street%20lighting">street lighting</a>.
The term can also refer to a <a href="Oil%20lamp">lamp</a> where the <a href="Candle%20wick">wick</a> burns in a cup or cavity, which can be of <a href="ceramic">ceramic</a> or <a href="stone">stone</a>.
